checkin enabled systems, so here's another example of using GPS location based systems, ie a smart phone + foursquare to checkin to a location to activate something to happen at that location.  This has been done a few times already in NYC has hacks, like you couldn't get into someone's party unless you checkedin on your phone at the door and then the door would open.  Here, a pet owner checkins into billboard type add and dog food is released feeding your dog.  http://www.psfk.com/2011/03/pets-win-when-you-check-in-on-foursquare-video.html

Great incite on the nature of human interaction, especially liked the bit "Emotions are not separated from reason, they are the foundation of it, showing what to value." Just as good design solves not only a physical need but also an emotional. http://www.ted.com/talks/david_brooks_the_social_animal.html
very cool project, the SXSW CNN persona shot http://www.cnn.com/2011/IREPORT/03/25/persona.sxsw.irpt/index.html

I like the quote Chris B posted from that Ted talk. Building on Palmer's presentation to us, there's an interesting divide between research with reliability and validity and that without. Neither is "wrong" but ours hard to truly prove. However, short of attaching anodes to the right parts of our brain to measure emotion we're always going to be without a technically reliable and valid way to do so. But there's plenty of smart people who realize the value of emotions and experiences.
like this video, nice combo of white board visuals, narrator goodness and screen mocks http://www.eqatec.com/Analytics/Overview.aspx

watched some of the 500startups demo day stuff yesterday and was really impressed with this education/gaming startup using math/games for education, very smart firm i think http://motionmathgames.com/
